name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Chicago Wood Dale - Elk Grove

reviews.text: with the rate paid in the location, the service provided is sub-bar cross the board. The staff did not say and give me the internet information until I tried and failed myself and went to the front desk. The lamps in the living room are not working. The room service is good (clearness of bedding). The staff did not explain the service well. The local transportation provided is very good since the location is so isolated.
reviews.title: hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in a 2 room suite with my family of 5 (three kids under 5) and found plenty of room for an inflatable mattress with minimal furniture rearrangement. The waiter at breakfast was more than accommodating when we requested food on the go, as well for a sit down meal the following morning. Travel to Woodfield mall was a breeze, and one of two routes to downtown chicago was accomplished within 25 minutes (Always check the DOT traffic report before hitting the road). The lobby was appealing and comfortable. The room, while dated, was the same. Pool was great for the kids (3.5' depth on both sides, 4' in the middle). FREE PARKING. Enjoyed 2 nights here at 3/4 of the expense required for a single night in downtown Chicago (where I lived for 40 years).
reviews.title: Great Value, short drive to attractions

reviews.text: Very polished, clean, and healthy appearance of amenities. Bed, linens, and pillows look great, but not too comfortable. However, very clean. Excellent lobby, bar and lounging area. Very condusive for a business trip. Breakfast is excellent. I will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Doubletree by Hilton, Wood Dale, IL

reviews.text: Easy in and out. Plenty of parking and nice open environs. Close to airport but very quiet even with planes taking off. Common areas very accessible and clean. Staff very friendly and will greet you with a smile. The cookies are to die for when you need a sugar rush. I will stay here again !
reviews.title: Comfortable and Affordable

reviews.text: Upon checking in (around 4:30 pm), the staff member checked to see if our room was clean--it wasn't, so we received another room. I don't know why we had to hear the back story from staff on getting our room ready. The room was fine - a suite actually with couch and second TV. The bathroom was clean but old--when I turned on the shower it felt like the faucet was loose enough to fall out if I wasn't extra gentle. The room had a slight odor, like it used to be a smoking room or something, but the sheets were clean and the bed comfortable. The walls were thin--we could hear our neighbors quite well. The breakfast is a rip-off, but if you don't have a car there isn't another choice. There is nothing near this hotel. For $10 the continental had limited fruit selections--the typical sliced cantaloupe and pineapple, no berries. There is no shuttle on weekends and it is about $25 plus tip to take American Taxi to/from the airport. The gym is small but functional. The cookies are nice and the staff is friendly enough. The hotel is what it is--one of very few options in Wood Dale, and a decent place to sleep and shower.
reviews.title: Could have tried harder, but guests are stuck

reviews.text: Very nice staff, the accommodations were very good, I will at this hotel again. The pool area was nice, but being in the back of the hotel, not very handy for access and very noisy something could be done about the acoustics. That aside it was a very nice stay
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel

reviews.text: On business and enjoying getting work done on my laptop in the lobby. Seems to be a clean comfortable hotel. Food enjoyable. Rooms of good size and bed was comfortable. Starbucks coffee in the lobby complementary till 10am.
reviews.title: Nice Place to StayOn

reviews.text: We discovered a gem of a property not far from O'Hare Airport, yet very quiet--it even had a pond with two families of young geese. A charming property, our only issue being that we left ourselves too little time to get to our event downtown because of traffic--but that was the freeway's fault, not the hotel's.
reviews.title: Great Value near the Windy City

reviews.text: Very relaxing location that is a little out of the way unless you have business or visiting locally. I stayed here verses downtown for a convention. Shopped on-line paid hundreds less. The room was spacious and clean, bed very comfortable, down pillows but they will supply foam if requested. Restaurant on-sight or a drive of fifteen minutes for many neighborhood or chain restaurants. Fifteen minutes from O'Hare.
reviews.title: Beat the Convention rates of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel room doors have gaps that led in light and noise. It was difficult to sleep. Our check in was not smooth. We had to wait 30mins while they cleaned our "dirty room" (quoting the hostess) she was unprofessional.
reviews.title: sleepless

reviews.text: First impression when you walk in the lobby is good: front desk staff is helpful and cheery, lobby/bar area is pleasant. Then you walk around the corner to the elevator and the hallways look a bit worn. Finally when you get to your room the feeling persists. The bathroom is dates and worse for wear. The bed is comfortable and breakfast was good so I guess for business travel that is all that really matters.
reviews.title: Tired Hotel in Good Location

reviews.text: This was my first trip out of town with my boyfriend and his kids and this would be their first time staying in a suite. Unfortunately, when we opened the door to the room, it was a two bed standard room. The hotel was over-booked and no longer had our reserved type of room available and there was no other Hilton brand around that had suites available. Doubletree ended up sending us to the Westin. Although it was an extremely nice king size suite, the bed did not compare to the dream beds of the Doubletree.
reviews.title: Too bad I couldn't stay.....

reviews.text: I love this DT Hotel- the staff is great and always helpful. If there is ever an issue-they work to resolve it immediately. The area is quiet and serene, and the hotel is clean, with great services. I come here for work and also personal relaxation time. Definitely a good choice for a quick getaway or business.
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.text: A very nice hotel with a warm and friendly staff. The breakfast area gets quite crowded. However, that is because of the excellent breakfast served. It was overall, an enjoyable stay. The location is excellent because it is close to all Chicagoland area activities with easy access. The price paid was well worth what you receive. I highly suggest this hotel for business or family travel.
reviews.title: Great Value among friends
excellent experience
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay . the staff was very warm and helpful and extremely nice. I was certainly looking for a place that was quite and away from all the cumbersome city life even though it was not too far from the city. My fiancée and I enjoyed our stay there . it was very clean considering how much of a neat freak I am I was definitely pleased and will do stay there again

Overall the experience was fine. The bathrooms were small a rather dated but worked. My main complaint was having the side door access deliberately locked from the outside whereby can't access it if you park on the side of the building, you have to drag your bags all the way around through the lobby, late at night perhaps limiting access but not all the time. All hotels offering side access should allow it! I requested a non smoking room yet the bed smelled of smoke as did the room when the vent was off. The toilet seat was so loose, it almost came off. Why can't the cleaning staff request such a noticable repair? In summary, the value was worth the stay despite the issues I encountered.
reviews.title: Wood Dale Doubletree
Nice but dated
reviews.text: Good location just outside of the premium priced Ohare hotels. The shared areas of the hotel have been updated but the rooms are dated. The only accessible outlet was in the bathroom. Some of the fixtures in the room were broken.

reviews.title: Great Business Stay
reviews.text: Hotel services and accomodations are great I heard the gym is a little small, but other than that the lobby is gorgeous and the rooms are very nice. Need to request a refridgerator and/or microwave and pay an additional nightly fee which was a little odd. The staff is courteous and very helpful and the cookie you get upon checkin is delicious. Hotel restaurant has tasty food and they serve Starbucks coffee. It's a quaint part of town and within a 10 mile radius has lots of fantastic restaurants, shops, etc.
The Doubletree Hotel is in and industrial park area however it has a country atmosphere.
reviews.title: Country setting

reviews.text: There is a nice pond in the front of the hotel with resident Canadian Geese and the hotel is surrounded by trees.
reviews.title: Great location, Great rooms
